meanings.sent1: She hurries to catch the bus every morning.
meanings.sent2: He hurries through his homework to play outside.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hurries to gather nuts before winter.
meanings.sent4: Time hurries like a river, never stopping.
meanings.sent5: The wind hurries through the trees, rustling the leaves.

meanings.sent1: The chef hurries to finish cooking before the guests arrive.
meanings.sent2: The students hurry to submit their assignments on time.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit hurries to escape the chasing fox.
meanings.sent4: The river hurries down the mountain, eager to reach the valley.
meanings.sent5: The bee hurries from flower to flower, collecting nectar.

meanings.definition: To cause to move or act with haste
meanings.sent1: The teacher hurries the students to complete the test before the bell rings.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise hurries the birds away from the tree.
meanings.sent3: The smell of food hurries the dog to the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: His urgent call hurries the ambulance to the accident scene.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock hurries him out of bed in the morning.
